DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate whether NEOSORB Plus antibacterial suture ( chlorhexidine diacetate coat PGLA910 ) inferior NEOSORB suture ( PGLA910 ) point intraoperative handling .
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Enrollment 1 . Urologic surgery need fascia subcutaneous tissue repair 2 . Clean clean-contaminated surgery 3 . Patients age 18 year 80 year 2 . Randomization 1 . NEOSORB Plus ( chlorhexidine diacetate coat PGLA910 ) NEOSORB ( PGLA910 ) suture 2 . Stratification operative method : Open surgery vs. laparoscopic robot-assisted laparoscopic surgery 3 . Follow-up 30 day 1 . Primary endpoint : intraoperative handling operation 2 . Secondary endpoint : wound heal assessment postoperative 1st ( +1 ) day 11th ( Â± 4 ) day 3 . Safety evaluation : counting adverse event within postoperative 30 day
DOC.criteria: Urologic surgery need fascia subcutaneous tissue repair Clean cleancontaminated surgery Contaminated surgery Wound require retention suture Suspicious malnutrition status Active infection status AIDS Incision sit prone expand , stretch , distend , require support Allergy hypersensitivity chlorhexidine diacetate Significant active medical illness opinion investigator would preclude protocol treatment
